annotation_1.eng: This cat is very good at hiding. The dark black of this cat helps it hide.

annotation_2.eng: What kinds of places would make it easy to see this cat?

annotation_3.eng: Where do you like to hide?

rows.annotation_1: This cat is very good at hiding. The dark black of this cat helps it hide.
rows.annotation_2: What kinds of places would make it easy to see this cat?
rows.annotation_3: Where do you like to hide?

annotation_1.eng: Was the cat under the bed before the boy looked there?

annotation_2.eng: This bed cover has lots of colorful stripes. Count how many different colors it has.

annotation_3.eng: The walls in this room have a free form design that doesn't repeat. Have you  seen walls like this before?

rows.annotation_1: Was the cat under the bed before the boy looked there?
rows.annotation_2: This bed cover has lots of colorful stripes. Count how many different colors it has.
rows.annotation_3: The walls in this room have a free form design that doesn't repeat. Have you  seen walls like this before?

rows.story_text: Is it on top of the cupboard?

story_text.eng: Is it on top of the cupboard?

annotation_1.eng: Instead of being on top of the cupboard, the cat is inside it.

annotation_2.eng: This cupboard has a beautiful design. How many colors does it have?

annotation_3.eng: Talk about the shapes and patterns on the cupboard doors.

rows.annotation_1: Instead of being on top of the cupboard, the cat is inside it.
rows.annotation_2: This cupboard has a beautiful design. How many colors does it have?
rows.annotation_3: Talk about the shapes and patterns on the cupboard doors.

annotation_1.eng: The cat is very easy to see right now. Too bad the boy is looking in the wrong place.

annotation_2.eng: Point at the strong colors on this page: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, and brown.

annotation_3.eng: Which colors of the rainbow are missing from the room?

rows.story_text: Is it next to the trash can?

story_text.eng: Is it next to the trash can?

annotation_1.eng: The cat must be very fast and quiet -- he was next to where the boy is now.

annotation_2.eng: Count the red bricks just below the window.

annotation_3.eng: There are many straight lines in this picture. Point to some curved lines.

annotation_1.eng: Which part of the cat is not inside the SOAP box?

annotation_2.eng: What is inside the basket? Is that where the cat sleeps?

annotation_3.eng: Notice that the wall does not line up with the squares of the floor.

annotation_1.eng: That poor boy is always looking in the wrong place.

annotation_2.eng: Do you think the boy ever finds the cat, or will the boy give up?

annotation_3.eng: This is the same wall pattern as on the last page, but the floor is a different color!

annotation_1.eng: It looks like the cat is in a cupboard or under a sink.

annotation_2.eng: Was the cat playing a game with the boy?

annotation_3.eng: What will the boy do with the cat now? Maybe he will feed it or play with it? What do you think?
